Yeah, just to be clear I'm not saying DeMar is as good as them at all. I was just saying DeMar has a similar style of play so he might age better than we think.

Well, kind of.
The high-priced contracts are one issue, but actually not the biggest. The biggest is that Ontario has a huge over-supply of electricity. When producers sign contracts, the utility guarantees they will purchase their electricity at a set rate. When Ontario has more electricity than they have demand, they ship it to the States on an excess contract for wholesale rates (AKA, at a significant loss to what they paid for it). Last year, they shipped about 1.7 Billion of electricity south for big losses.
So Ontario can't buy Quebec's electricity for less because they already have too much supply they are locked into taking (but that would have been the smart way to do it).
Really, the whole situation is such a clusterfuck you wonder how on Earth they managed to screw things up this bad without trying.

Don't make the mistake of thinking Shell in 1970 = Shell in 2017. This guy can only be held responsible for the company under his leadership, not the actions of Shell 30 years ago. And the solution is not to say "Fuck them no matter what" imo. It's to applaud them for things like this, and critisize them for the opposite. This is going to be a lot easier if Shell is working with us, not against us.
But also, don't blame oil companies for causing climate change. If it wasn't Shell, it would be BP or some other company. They're just filling a market demand. The problem *is* the demand, not those that provide for it.

Yeah, of course they aren't lobbying for it. If they spent all their money lobbying for taxes that hurt them, well thats a terrible business plan and we could never expect them to do that. But I don't think that makes their words meaningless.
Its just fun basketball discussion. Chill out. No need to go calling me (and the rest of the sub) stupid.

No, sorry.
First, they are investing 1 Billion a year into renewables, so they are doing something.
But theyre still an oil company. You can't expect them to lead the fight against oil. And I don't think its meaningless that even they are getting on board with this.
I like to see stuff like this, I think we have to give credit when it's due and I'm glad he might be an ally of renewables, not an enemy.

WRITING.TITLE: Girlfriend [19F] got really upset at me [20M] on the evening of a big midterm
WRITING.TEXT:
Sorry, lot of venting here.
So I just had a huge legal midterm. Last night, as I was frantically cramming my girlfriend flipped out at me. She's been getting mad at me a lot lately (which has been incredibly frustrating on its own, but thats a whole different issue) but this one got me.
She started texting me, seemingly got very happy (although I didn't realize how upset she was). I tried to reply as best I could, but like I said, I was frantically cramming for this exam.
Then, she called me. I answered, and we talked for about 20 minutes before she hung up on me (conversation was about about how she felt I didn't care and I didn't love her).
I texted her a lot after, but basically I ended it a little afer 12:30 with a text saying "I love you, and I will come see you right after this exam tomorrow, but I need to goto sleep right because this exam starts at 8 AM."
The thing is, this is the THIRD time she's done this. She seems to think I should just throw my school aside and focus on her. She said if i was upset she would spend all night helping me even if she had a diploma the next morning.
The thing is, she doesn't have a diploma...she isn't even in school right now. And I wouldn't do that to her. It's really fucking easy to say you would when you don't actually have to deal with it.
Mostly, instead of fixing what she was upset about, I'm just pissed right now. Im pissed she put me in this situation AGAIN.
Do I have a right to be mad? I honestly dont even know.
Any advice is REALLY appreciated.
TL:DR My girlfriend got really upset with me late the night before a huge test (again), I'm pissed about it and I think this isnt fair to me.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I [20M] tell my girlfriend [19F] we can't argue this much?
WRITING.TEXT:
I couldn't find a better way to word that, but I think it gets the point across.
We've been arguing a lot lately. Like every few days. The thing is, it's always her mad (literally almost never me).
I try to listen to her, see what she's angry about, and then put some effort into fixing whatever the problem is. I feel like I've made a lot of changes to try and improve things. But I seem to get no where. Every 3 days (give or take a couple days) there's another argument, seemingly no matter what. I've even had big talks to try and figure out if there is a "root cause", but it got me nowhere.
I can't do things like this anymore. Aside from the emotional burden (which sucks obviously) of arguing all the time, this is wreaking havoc on my schedule.
I'm in university and I have a really heavy courseload I sometimes struggle to keep up with. I'm also trying to start my own business on the side (something that is very important to me). Between this, my time not spent with her is packed (and I still manage to see her a fair amount). But it really kills me when all of a sudden my homework/studying/business is interrupted and I spend hours talking to her, on the phone with her, going to see her. If this was every now and then, I wouldnt mind, shit happens, relationships are work and you make time. But I can't spontaneously make time this often anymore.
I love my girlfriend, and I want things to work. But she seems perenially unhappy and I don't know what to do (the thing is, when we're together she's 100% happy, it's always when we aren't). But if things are always going to be like this, I can't do it anymore.
TL;DR: How do I more sensitively say that I can't argue this much and be okay with it? Any and all advice is appreciated =D

Hi guys!
So I have my own portfolio of stocks. Currently, it consists of 13 dividend paying stocks (12 stocks, 1 mutual fund actually). I'm currently in school, so I don't add any money. However, I'll leave soon and be able to start buying up more shares soon.

So how many is too many?

WRITING.TITLE: Anthony Bennett Advanced Look
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys! I've just put together some interesting stuff about AB.
First, his plain stats line up like this:
11.5 MPG/41.3 FG%/27.1 3PT%/72.2 FT%/3.4 RPG/0.5 APG/0.5 TOV/5.0 PPG
Not so great obviously. He doesn't stand out anywhere. But, when you look at his per-36 numbers, they look like this:
10.6 RPG/3.4 ORB/1.6 APG/1.6 TOV/2.5 PF/15.7 PPG
Those are decent per-36 numbers. Turnovers and fouls are reasonable, rebounding and points are respectable (nothing spectacular by any means, but decent). That gives the impression that Bennett is reasonably productive in his time on the floor.
Of course that doesn't include his efficiency numbers, which are horrible. Bennett has not shown the ability to be efficient from the field. But let's break his field goal attempts down a little:
Bennett averages 4 field goal attempts. Of those 4, 2.1 are 3-Point attempts. Just 1.9 are 2-Point attempts. Per-36, this works out to 6.5 3 point attempts. That's an absurd number for someone shooting 27.1% from 3 this season, and 26.1% in his career.
On two-pointers, Bennett has actually been pretty efficient. He is shooting 56.8%, by far his career best (closest is 43% in Minnesota).
So Bennett might actually have some efficiency promise, but he would have to drastically cut down on his 3 attempts, and take more 2's.
Even then, Bennett might not look like an NBA player. But there is hope. It's pretty clear he's taking a ridiculous number of 3's given his percentages. Maybe, if you could get that under control, Bennett might look a little better.

WRITING.TITLE: How to Find a Good Acupuncturist
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys! I'm glad to join the community. The one thing I've noticed as an acupuncture enthusiast is the quality of the practitioner closely relates to the quality of the acupuncture itself. If the practitioner doesn't know what they're doing, you won't see the results you should. Acupoints have to be hit with accuracy. That's the reason I started http://findacupuncture.ca, to try and create a high quality resource for finding acupuncture. With that being said, I have a few basic tips to try and make sure you get the right practitioner: Get Reccomendations. Do you know someone that has recieved acupuncture care? See who they went to. If they got good results, there is a good chance you will to. Ask their specialty. This is one people very commonly overlook. Often, you didn't go to the wrong acupuncturist, you just went to an acupuncturist that specialized in another field. Acupuncture treats such a huge variety of conditions that you have to be aware of which niche you fit in. Look online to see other people's opinions. Reviews and forums are always good resources to check on reputations. If they look solid online, chances are they are solid. See how long they've been practicing in the area for. Acupuncturists rely largely on word of mouth business. If they have been in the area for longer, there is a better chance they are reputable. Hope that helps! Id love to hear your guys comments below!

WRITING.TITLE: How to Find a Good Acupuncturist
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys!
I'm glad to join the community. The one thing I've noticed as an acupuncture enthusiasist is the quality of the practitioner closely relates to the quality of the acupuncture itself. If the practitioner doesn't know what they're doing, you won't see the results you should. Acupoints have to be hit with accuracy. That's the reason I started a directory, to try and create a high quality resource for finding acupuncture.
With that being said, I have a few basic tips to try and make sure you get the right practitioner:
*Get Reccomendations*. Do you know someone that has recieved acupuncture care? See who they went to. If they got good results, there is a good chance you will to.
*Ask their specialty*. This is one people very commonly overlook. Often, you didn't go to the wrong acupuncturist, you just went to an acupuncturist that specialized in another field. Acupuncture treats such a huge variety of conditions that you have to be aware of which niche you fit in.
*Look online to see other people's opinions*. Reviews and forums are always good resources to check on reputations. If they look solid online, chances are they are solid.
*See how long they've been practicing in the area for*. Acupuncturists rely largely on word of mouth business. If they have been in the area for longer, there is a better chance they are reputable.
Hope that helps! Id love to hear your guys comments below!

http://findacupuncture.ca

WRITING.TITLE: 335i vs 328i maintenance costs?
WRITING.TEXT:
So for background, I previously owned a 2008 BMW 328xi sedan. It was a fantastic car, so Im looking to get a another one.
Im looking anywhere in the 2007 to 2011 year range. I have heard that 335i is far more expensive to mantain than a 328 (as in double the cost). Does anyone have experience or knowledge from one or both of these?
I found a fantastic 08 coupe with 74,000 kms on it (46,000 miles). It was clearly very well taken care of. The only thing that makes me nervous is the 335i (addition of twin turbos). All thoughts experience and input is very welcome and helpful!

WRITING.TITLE: 2009 Audi A4 rust problems?
WRITING.TEXT:
Ive been looking at some 2009 to 2010 Audi A4s (approx 100,000 kms on them). Ive looked at 3 so far and all 3 had rust on the wheel wells.
My question is, is this that common of a problem or did I hit 3 bad ones? Ive looked at dozens of BMWs (and owned one) and havent seen any rust at all yet, so it does worry me.
Is there some defiency that makes rust an issue? My worry is that even if I find one rust-free, will this be something I worry about in the future?
Anyone elses experience is welcome!!

WRITING.TITLE: Classier jacket ideas for the bar?
WRITING.TEXT: Im looking for a lightweight summer jacket I can wear to the bar and around. So a little classier but still casual enough it will fit in. Any ideas on jackets or types of jackets?

WRITING.TITLE: Getting sued after car crash
WRITING.TEXT:
So Ill just provide the basic details:
-I live in Alberta, Canada -I was at fault in the car crash -My insurance policy covers 1M in lawsuits
It was a relatively minor crash. I hit the side of the other car while turning left.
It was surprising because there were very minor injuries on site. The other driver complained of shoulder pain, and thought it was broke. The EMTs looked her over quickly and said it wasnt broken, only bruised from the seat belt. They offered to take her to the hospital (but told her they didn't believe it was neccesary). She declined.
Then, today (about 3 weeks later) I get a call from my insurance company telling me she's retained a lawyer. Thats about all I know as of now.
So what are my options here? Whats my best course of action? Im really lost and surprised here, I did not expect a lawsuit from this at all and Ive never been in a similar situation before.

WRITING.TITLE: Buying 2009 BMW - Price and Negotiation Advice
WRITING.TEXT:
So I live in Alberta, Canada for starters. And I lied a little, I'm not set on buying this car at all yet. In fact I'm still looking at a lot of other cars. I will be buying outright with no trade in. Its at a Nissan dealership.
So the car in question is a 2009 BMW 328XI with 130k kms (no navigation or comfort access). The list price is $15,900 (with 5% GST tax on top of whatever it sells for). It was originally listed for 1k more but they dropped the price (its been for sale for 24 days on AutoTrader).
There were a few things I disliked about the car despite its overall good condition:
-It was below the minimum level for oil -There was almost no gas in it (range: 10km) -There was a tear on the leather in th drivers seat -Some small plastic meshing in the front bumper was broke...not a big deal -The radio display wasn't right(knowing BMW, potentially a pricey fix)
The salesman knew we were looking at a similar car later that day for just 11k in a private deal. He mumbled out that he might be able to get to "mid 14's" or "low 14's" or "14.9". This was without us even asking, the salesman seemed to know they were way out of line with the other car I was looking at. The car is in line with other similar dealership cars listed (many private cars are listed for a lot less) but I know they are selling for less. My brother bought an 09 (with more options) and 80k kms for 13k a few months ago. I do like the color of the car and the look better (has nice rims as well)...hence why Im looking at it over cheaper cars.
Right now my strategy would be to hit him with a number that I am willing to pay and stick to it (all fees and everything exept for GST have to fit in this). If anyone has a better strategy Im all ears. My question is, how much can I expect to shave off the price? How should I get them there? I really have no idea on whats reasonable to expect a dealership to drop in price. How do I really get the best deal in a car like this? Should I compare it to other cars? Or point out its damage?
Any advice is appreciated!

WRITING.TITLE: Using social authority with PBNs?
WRITING.TEXT:
Ive heard a lot about PBNs losing their effectiveness in the past 2 years. However, they still can be very effective. Ive heard one way to increase their effectiveness is to combine them with social authority. Whats your guys experiences with this?
Does hitting them with social authority mean the link being shared on social networks, or the social accounts connected to the PBN getting followers/likes/shares/etc,. Has it helped?

WRITING.TITLE: How to get domain authority on a fresh domain?
WRITING.TEXT:
Ive been looking at snagging an established domain but it appears that isnt possible right now. Second option is to start with a fresh domain, whats the first step in building some DA after getting a new domain so that I can compete with those already ranking?
It doesnt have to be crazy high at all, competitors have like 15 max. Just a boost to be competitive.

WRITING.TITLE: My girkfriend (18F) thinks Im hiding something because I dont like her looking through my (19M) phone
WRITING.TEXT:
My girlfriend of one year and I got in an arguement today, she believes Im hiding something because I dont like her looking through my phone. Actually, I just dont like anyone touching my phone at all. Ive always been private with my phone, I dont even like giving it to friends to to use for calls.
Im not hiding anything from my girlfriend, I have never even thought of cheating on her so I cant even pinpoint a real reason I dont like it, I just dont. Its not like shes never on it, her fingerprint is in my phone so she can get in it anytime. If Im driving and I get a text, Ill ask her to reply for me and she goes on it all the time for music and to look at pictures and stuff. And Im pretty sure shes seen everything on it at some point or another. None of that bothers me at all. Its when she does stuff like today, she grabs it and just starts randomly searching through it. She goes through everything, my snapchat, my reddit, all my texts, all my internet tabs....just everything. She even turns so I cant see what shes looking at. She can see me get uncomfortable, even nervous looking which makes her feel like Im hiding something (I dont know what though). In reality, Im just a private person and it bugs me.
I feel like Im just expecting a reasonable level of privacy, maybe I'm wrong though...I want to talk to her about this before it becomes an even bigger deal but I dont evwn know what to say.

WRITING.TITLE: Buying domain with authority?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm looking to buy a domain with some authority already. Any suggestions on where to buy or what metrics to aim for? I'm struggling to find one in my niche with at least decent Authority (for a reasonable price). What things should i check when buying?
Right now I check if it's indexed, check DA/PA and TF/CF.
